intro: Bolax prolifer, commonly known as the common bolax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Bolax prolifer thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
